New Records: The Cleveland Cavaliers extended their undefeated streak to 15 games, joining an elite group of teams that have started a season with 15 straight wins.
Key Match Events: Darius Garland led the Cavs with 25 points, 12 assists and five rebounds, while Ty Jerome added 24 points and Evan Mobley put up 23 points with 11 assists.
Mobley had the play of the night when he blocked Hornets forward Brandon Miller’s dunk attempt with two minutes remaining.
Pre-Game Insights: The Cavaliers notched their 14th consecutive win Friday night against the Chicago Bulls for a franchise record.
Cleveland’s next game is its biggest test: A Tuesday road game against the defending champion Boston Celtics in the NBA Cup.
Post-Match Reflections: Cleveland’s start isn’t a fluke. They are proving night after night this start isn’t a fluke. They are a rising power in the NBA.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Atkinson has overhauled an offense that played slow last year and relied too heavily on stale pick and rolls.
Cleveland leads the league in 3-point shooting percentage and entered Sunday shooting 50 percent on wide-open 3s (nearest defender at least 6 feet away).
Others: The Hornets dropped to 5-8 with the loss.
